ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.2_0: At that time Venerable Udāyī was associating with and visiting a number of families in Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.3_0: At one time a certain woman was attractive and graceful,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.4_0: One morning Udāyī robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to the house of a beautiful widow.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.4_1: and after going, he sat down on the prepared seat.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.5_1: bowed, sat down to one side,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.6_0: Udāyī educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired that woman with a Dhamma talk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.8_0: “Venerable, please tell me what you need.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.9_0: I’m able to give robes, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicines.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.10_0: “It’s not hard for us to get those requisites.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.11_0: Give instead what’s hard for us to get.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.17_0: she entered her bedroom, took off her wrap, and lay back on the bed.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.18_0: Udāyī approached her and spat out,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.21_0: That woman complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.22_0: “These Sakyan ascetics are shameless and immoral liars.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.23_0: Sure, they claim to be of principled and moral conduct, to be celibate, truthful, ethical, and of good character.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.24_0: But they don’t have the qualities of an ascetic or a brahmin;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.26_0: How can the ascetic Udāyī request sexual intercourse from me, but then spit out, ‘Who would touch this foul-smelling wretch!’ and depart?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.27_0: What’s bad about me? How am I foul-smelling?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.1.28_0: In what way am I inferior to whom?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.3_0: How can the ascetic Udāyī request sexual intercourse from me, but then spit out, ‘Who would touch this foul-smelling wretch!’ and depart?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.4_0: What’s the point of this bad deed? What’s the miserable and sad?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.5_0: The monks heard the complaints of those women,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.6_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.7_0: “How can Venerable Udāyī commend the satisfaction of his own desires in the presence of a woman?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.9_0: The Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Udāyī:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.10_0: “Is it true, Udāyī, that you commended the satisfaction of your own desires in the presence of a woman?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.13_0: “It’s not suitable, foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.14_0: How can you commend the satisfaction of your own desires in the presence of a woman?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.15_0: Haven’t I given many teachings for the sake of dispassion ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.16_0: for the stilling of the fevers of sense desire?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.17_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.18_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:1.2.19.1_0: ‘If a monk, overcome by lust and with a distorted mind, encourages a woman to satisfy his own desires: “Sister, she provides the highest service who in this way satisfies one like me, who is virtuous, celibate, and of good character,” and if it is a reference to sexual intercourse, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.6_0: having lust, longing for, in love with.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.8_0: A desiring mind is distorted; an angry mind is distorted; a deluded mind is distorted.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.9_0: But in this case “distorted” refers to the desiring mind.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:2.33_0: if it is a reference to the sexual act.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.3_0: It is a woman, but he is unsure of it ...

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.14_0: If the monk encourages the _paṇḍaka_ to satisfy his own desires, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.24_0: If the monk encourages both women to satisfy his own desires, he commits two offenses entailing suspension.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-ss4:3.1.27_0: If the monk encourages both of them to satisfy his own desires, he commits one offense entailing suspension and one offense of wrong conduct.
